summary: Restore the app’s original global theme colors by replacing the current :root and .dark CSS variables with the provided OKLCH light/dark palettes applied across the entire app.
architectural_notes: Use the provided OKLCH design tokens as the single source of truth for global theming by fully replacing current :root and .dark variables and applying them app-wide.
known_issues: Global color styles appear missing (site mostly black/white); needs restoration of original background, border, and text colors via theme variables.

existing_features.title: Replace the app’s global theme CSS variables in `frontend/src/index.css` by updating the `:root` (light) and `.dark` (dark) blocks to use the exact OKLCH variable values provided by the user for all listed tokens, and add any missing custom tokens from the provided list so they are available globally.

Ensure the restored theme variables are used consistently by Tailwind utilities and existing component styles by keeping variable formats compatible with the Tailwind config (i.e., variables used via `oklch(var(--token))` must be defined as space-separated OKLCH channels rather than nested `oklch(...)` strings).
